Name: Small pitcher with a spherical belly and trefoil spout
Description: This beautiful small pitcher, which comes from the excavations of B. Grenfell and A. Hunt at El-Bahnasa in 1904-1905, is made of greenish coloured clear glass. It is distinguished by a flat base, a round belly, a slightly flaring cylindrical neck and a lip that takes the elegant form of  a trefoil leaf. The upper part  of the handle is decorated with lines. The piece dates from the 2nd or 3rd century of our time.
